bibl.title: Letter from Robert Carter to [George] Nicholas, August 7, 1727

div1.p: Robert Carter writes to his son-in-law, [George] Nicholas, August 7, 1727, to report on the condition of William Robertson, who had broken his leg, and to send his respects to Nicholas' family.

div1.head: Letter from Robert Carter to [George] Nicholas, August 7, 1727

opener.dateline:
[Corotoman, Lancaster County, Virginia]
Augt the 7th 1727
Dr. Nicholas

div1.p:
Yours by Mr. Stagg came to me last
night he tells me by a line he saw Mr. Robertson in the morning
that his fever had quite left him and his Surgeons had—
great hopes of his doing well

The rest of your Lettr: needs no anwer
at present you ought to make it a Secret as you may be sure
I shall I hope this find your family all in good health
I am

div1.head: NOTES
div1.note: Source copy consulted: Robert Carter letter book, 1727 May-1728 July, Robert Carter Papers (acc. no. 3807), Albert and Shirley Small Special Collections Library, University of Virginia.
